newsitem.title: USA: Nasdaq flies high on rosy predictions for chips.
newsitem.headline: Nasdaq flies high on rosy predictions for chips.

text.p: Tech stocks vaulted higher after the Semiconductor Industry Association said it expected the worldwide market for semiconductor chips to grow 7.4 percent in 1997 to $138.8 billion and return to double-digit growth in 1998 and 1999.
The Nasdaq Composite Index, heavy with tech stocks, climbed 15.28, over 1.27 percent to close unofficially at 1221.51.
"Chip demand is getting better, and the whole market did well today," said a trader at Wheat First Securities. "I also think you saw some short-covering."
The Dow Jones Industrial average rose 36 points to about 6030.
Intel Corp rose 3-1/8 to 109-7/8, Sun Microsystems rose 2-1/8 to 61, and Cisco Systems rose 3-3/4 to 62-7/8.
